I am trying to make a filter via dropdown menu that's linked to my hubDB. Basically, a user can select an option from "All Locations" to "Location A" "Location B" and then it will render out everybody who is in Location A only or Location B, or all.

I have the hubDB data set up but it is rendering everybody and just ignoring the select. How would I do this in HubSpot?
How do we implement query params on the `crm_objects` function? I can’t get `contains` to work with the property `ip__ecomm_bridge__source_store_id__contains=<store_id>` . Am I doing something wrong?
i wonder if the __s in the field name are breaking it
is store_id an integer?
nope. It pretty prints as an array
Yeah I was super perplexed on the double underscores in the property name
maybe instead of contains - in? because with contains - they all need to match right
doesn’t work
odd

Can you share a shortened version of your code? Without seeing it, try something like:
```{% set row = hubdb_table_rows(your_table_id, 'locations__contains=1,2' %}```
where `1,2` are the id’s of the locations column option names
Drag and Drop areas are not supported in email templates at this time.
